intro: Microlicia piatensis, commonly known as the Piatensian microlicia, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers and hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in humid tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
